channel.title: CVE Feed for Adobe -- Connect
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Adobe -- Connect

item.title: CVE-2021-36062|2024-09-17T00:46:06.229Z -- adobe -- connect
item.description: Adobe Connect version 11.2.2 (and earlier) is affected by a Reflected Cross-site Scripting vulnerability that could be abused by an attacker to inject malicious scripts into vulnerable form fields. If an attacker is able to convince a victim to visit a URL referencing a vulnerable page, malicious JavaScript content may be executed within the context of the victim's browser.

item.title: CVE-2021-36063|2024-09-17T02:37:42.482Z -- adobe -- connect
item.description: Adobe Connect version 11.2.2 (and earlier) is affected by a Reflected Cross-site Scripting vulnerability that could be abused by an attacker to inject malicious scripts into vulnerable form fields. Malicious JavaScript may be executed in a victim’s browser when they browse to the page containing the vulnerable field.

item.title: CVE-2021-28579|2024-09-17T01:25:30.169Z -- adobe -- connect
item.description: Adobe Connect version 11.2.1 (and earlier) is affected by an Improper access control vulnerability that can lead to the elevation of privileges. An attacker with 'Learner' permissions can leverage this scenario to access the list of event participants.

item.title: CVE-2021-40721|2024-09-17T03:08:14.697Z -- adobe -- connect
item.description: Adobe Connect version 11.2.3 (and earlier) is affected by a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. If an attacker is able to convince a victim to visit a URL referencing a vulnerable page, malicious JavaScript content may be executed within the context of the victim's browser.

item.title: CVE-2020-24442|2024-09-17T00:06:24.238Z -- adobe -- connect
item.description: Adobe Connect version 11.0 (and earlier) is affected by a reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability. If an attacker is able to convince a victim to visit a URL referencing a vulnerable page, malicious JavaScript content may be executed within the context of the victim's browser.

item.title: CVE-2021-36063|2024-08-04T00:47:43.805Z -- adobe -- connect
item.description: Adobe Connect version 11.2.2 (and earlier) is affected by a Reflected Cross-site Scripting vulnerability that could be abused by an attacker to inject malicious scripts into vulnerable form fields. Malicious JavaScript may be executed in a victim’s browser when they browse to the page containing the vulnerable field.
